alert.note: Alert for Richmond; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 6:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, northwestern Richmond, central Westmoreland and central Essex Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wicomico River to Newland to near Newtown. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Montross around 705 PM EDT. Coles Point around 730 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Lerty, Ethel, Currioman Landing, Owenton, Singerly, Mount Holly, Peeds, Rexburg, Foneswood and Stratford Hall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Richmond; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland
